meanings.definition: To surpass in feeling or emotion.
meanings.sent1: She outfeels her friend when watching sad movies.
meanings.sent2: He always outfeels everyone at the emotional scenes in plays.
meanings.sent3: The puppy outfeels the kitten when it comes to excitement over treats.
meanings.sent4: His love for her outfeels any other emotion he has ever experienced.
meanings.sent5: The sunset outfeels any painting he has ever seen.

meanings.definition: To experience a stronger emotion than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the movie, she outfeels her brother's fear with her excitement.
meanings.sent2: He outfeels his friends when it comes to joy at surprise parties.
meanings.sent3: The child outfeels the adults when it comes to wonder at the magic show.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outfeels any sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The victory outfeels any defeat they have faced before.
